name: Chocolate may be ____________ romantic—it contains chemicals that cause you to feel like you’re in love.
However, chocolate, which may cause feelings of love in some people, can ____________ severe headaches for others.
By exchanging gifts, a person in love sometimes discovers that the love is ____________ and that his or her feelings are returned
According to a recent scientific study, women with large chins have a greater ____________ to cheat in relationships
A(n) ____________ of certain chemicals in the brain causes the racing heart, blushing, and sweaty palms of someone in love.
In the natural world, there is an element of ____________ in winning a mate
Another title for this reading could be _____.

options.B: The Right Way to Choose a Mate
options.C: Explaining Why We Fall in Love

name: How do the Fulbe people of Cameroon feel about love?

options.A: Everyone falls in love in the same way.
options.B: The men’s wives don’t want them around.
options.C: It is shameful to be controlled by love.
options.D: Men can fall in love, but women cannot.

name: Which choice best expresses the meaning of this theory in line 42?

options.A: Marriage is too important to leave to chance.
options.B: Without the approval of family, romantic love rarely succeeds.
options.C: Romantic love is based on pleasant memories that we try to find again.
options.D: Memories of comfort and affection can satisfy our need for romantic love.

name: According to evolutionary psychology, why would a woman choose a man with rugged features?

options.C: to protect her from animals and other threats
options.D: because he is more likely to have a 70 percent waist-to-hip ratio

name: Why did Marazziti probably choose to study similarities between love and OCD?

options.A: She wanted to better understand her own experiences.
options.B: She had naturally low serotonin levels.
options.C: Other researchers felt it was an important area to study.
options.D: She suffered from a mental illness.

name: According to researchers, which chemical is most closely related to successful long-term relationships?

options.B: She had naturally low serotonin levels.oxytocin

name: What advice would Helen Fisher probably give to couples who want a long-term relationship?

options.C: Keep your partner’s photo in your wallet.
options.D: Spend time apart so you appreciate each other when you’re together.

name: Jennifer Holland’s favorite species of bird of paradise is Carola’s parotia. Its dance 1. @@ includes motions such as bowing, flapping, and 2. @@ to move the heavy and 3. @@ wirelike feathers on its head, in hopes of winning one of the watching females. “Its mating dance is so 4. @@ that I could hardly keep from laughing.”For a couple of nights, Holland stayed in a tiny village with a local family. It is the custom of the local people to build a fire pit in the center of the room. Because she was not accustomed to the smoke, it was very 5. @@ on her eyes and lungs. “My eyes watered constantly, I coughed like a new smoker, and I had to step outside regularly to get fresh air—much to the delight of the local kids who sat on the steps waiting for us to emerge.”

In addition, the genetically modified (GM) rice seed boosted crop production by almost 10 percent. There has been resistance to using GM grains as food crops— but some think this news from China may signal an important and possibly 2. @@ change.For the study, two types of rice were genetically altered to resist two common insect 3. @@, which usually require heavy use of pesticides to control. In Malaysian Borneo, hotels are involved in a battle with guests over a very smelly fruit called the durian. The smell of the durian is hard to describe, and has been compared to rotten fish or a garbage dump. This is why it is 1. @@ for durians to be kept outside the hotel. Hotel staff must 2. @@ keep watch for this food because guests often try to smuggle it in. When the fruit is in season, hotel managers in Kuching must work harder to keep it out. A hotel that smells of durian will find that the number of guests visiting it quickly 3. @@. But since it’s not 4. @@ to check every single guest entering the hotel, a certain number of durians inevitably get through.
